question: 引く
sourceAnswer: to{}{pull/tug/lead-(e.g.-a-horse)} | to{}{draw-(attention,-sympathy,-etc.)/attract-(e.g.-interest)} | to{}{draw-back-(e.g.-one's-hand)/draw-in-(one's-chin,-stomach,-etc.)/pull-in} | to{}draw-(a-card,-mahjong-tile,-etc.) | to{}draw-(a-line,-plan,-etc.) | to{}catch-(a-cold) | to{}play-(a-stringed-or-keyboard-instrument) | to{}{look-up-(in-a-dictionary,-phone-book,-etc.)/consult/check} | to{}{haul/pull-(vehicles)} | to{}{subtract/deduct} | to{}{recede/ebb/fade} | to{}{be-descend-from/inherit-(a-characteristic)} | to{}{quote/cite/raise-(as-evidence)} | to{}{lay-on-(electricity,-gas,-etc.)/install-(e.g.-a-telephone)/supply-(e.g.-water)} | to{}hold-(e.g.-a-note) | to{}{apply-(e.g.-lipstick)/oil-(e.g.-a-pan)/wax-(e.g.-a-floor)} | to:{move-back/draw-back/recede} | to:{lessen/subside/ebb/go-down-(e.g.-of-swelling)} | to:{resign/retire/quit}
sourceMnemonic:
This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>pull</kanji> and the verb version vocab means <vocabulary>to pull</vocabulary>.

This word has other meanings too! When you <kanji>pull</kanji> numbers away from other numbers, what you're really doing is subtracting them. That's why this word also means <vocabulary>to subtract</vocabulary>. And when you <kanji>pull</kanji> something towards you, that's <vocabulary>to attract</vocabulary> it.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. The reading (<ja>ひ</ja>) is the same as the one you learned for the kanji, meaning you should already know it!
